[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Side Channel: Timing] [Credential Comparison] Are credential paths compared using constant-time comparison, or can timing attacks leak information about valid credential locations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Side Channel: Error Messages] [Information Leakage] Do error messages during file store creation leak information about filesystem structure, credential locations, or GCS bucket existence? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Access Control: GCS] [Credential Scope] Do GCS service account keys have minimal required permissions, or can compromised keys be used for broader cloud access beyond indexer needs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Access Control: Filesystem] [Permission Check] Does LocalFileStore creation check that the process has appropriate read/write permissions before attempting operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Access Control: Configuration] [Privilege Escalation] Can low-privilege users modify the configuration file to point to sensitive directories or GCS buckets they shouldn't access? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Audit: Logging] [Credential Exposure] Are file store initialization events logged, and if so, are credentials properly redacted from logs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Audit: Metrics] [Anomaly Detection] Can file store creation failures or configuration changes be monitored for anomalous patterns indicating attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Dependency: serde] [Deserialization Gadgets] Can vulnerabilities in serde crate be exploited through malicious configuration files to achieve arbitrary code execution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Dependency: PathBuf] [Standard Library] Are there known vulnerabilities in Rust standard library's PathBuf implementation that could affect this configuration? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Type System: Enum] [Exhaustiveness] Are all match arms on IndexerGrpcFileStoreConfig exhaustive, preventing undefined behavior from new enum variants? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Type System: Trait Object] [Dynamic Dispatch] Can trait object type confusion between IFileStore implementations cause security vulnerabilities through vtable manipulation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Environment: Container] [Volume Mounting] In containerized deployments, can volume mounting misconfiguration allow LocalFileStore to escape container boundaries? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Environment: Permissions] [File Creation Mask] Are umask settings respected when creating files through LocalFileStore, or can they be created with insecure default permissions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Environment: Current Directory] [Working Directory Attack] Can attackers manipulate the working directory before indexer startup to exploit the current_dir().unwrap() in Default implementation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [API: GCS] [Authentication] Does GCS authentication properly validate service account keys, or can malformed keys be accepted and later exploited? (High)
